bug.author: phemmer
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/CosineDecay>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/CosineDecay</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/CosineDecayRestarts>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/CosineDecayRestarts</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/LinearCosineDecay>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/LinearCosineDecay</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/NoisyLinearCosineDecay>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/NoisyLinearCosineDecay</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/schedules/ExponentialDecay>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/schedules/ExponentialDecay</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/schedules/InverseTimeDecay>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/schedules/InverseTimeDecay</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/schedules/PiecewiseConstantDecay>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/schedules/PiecewiseConstantDecay</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/schedules/PolynomialDecay>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/schedules/PolynomialDecay</denchmark-link>
May be present on others, but I'm not going to scour the web site looking. <denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
The general documentation of these classes does not show up on the web site. This leads to confusion as many of them have argument documentation containing statements such as "See the decay computation above", when there is no documented computation above. Instead you have to open the source code to see the documentation that is mentioned. Here's an example: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1826947/79771096-4f2dea00-82fc-11ea-8373-ec3572b00f3b.png></denchmark-link>
And here's the missing documentation: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1826947/79771213-77b5e400-82fc-11ea-9d0d-2dc9efc02232.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Check the nightly version, it has what you want.

Ah, ok. Yeah, looks like this was fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/a3d80814afc007dbe0d2db6c02185d774e6850ec>a3d8081</denchmark-link>
Thanks. Will close
